alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 2:11AM CDT until June 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR CHEROKEE...SOUTHERN CRAWFORD...WESTERN NEWTON AND WESTERN JASPER COUNTIES... At 211 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from West Mineral to Treece to Seneca, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Scammon and West Mineral around 215 AM CDT. Galena, Cherokee and Weir around 220 AM CDT. Columbus around 225 AM CDT. Pittsburg and Shoal Creek Drive around 230 AM CDT. Joplin, Carl Junction, Duquesne, Leawood, Silver Creek and Saginaw around 235 AM CDT. Oronogo and Duenweg around 240 AM CDT. Carterville around 245 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Loma Linda, Airport Drive, Lowell, Sherman, Chicopee, Asbury, Redings Mill, Grand Falls Plaza, Shoal Creek Estates and Waco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 49 between mile markers 16 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
